creditline: Gift of funds from Mary and Bob Mersky
description: pieces of fragmented material, in colorful, pixilated designs, layered over each other to form an abstract dimensional image; turquoise background; red rectangle, arranged vertically in C; yellow shape with tiny dots in TC; black frame; long, skinny geometric shape on the R
medium: Dye sublimation prints on aluminum, latex paint
text: New Moon Construction, Number 10, is a meditation upon photographic possibility, and the power of the medium to seemingly transform two dimensional spaces into three.  Using vividly colored photographic prints to be mounted, cut, manipulated, and staged for framing, Shirreff creates a photographic montage rooted in abstraction both materially and conceptually.  The play of surfaces, light, and color heighten the object’s material ambiguity—is it a photograph or a sculpture'—while underscoring the elemental allure of its forms.
title: New Moon Construction, Number 10
